intro: Cathcartia delavayi, commonly known as the Delavay's cathcartia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southwestern China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes, often in forested areas. Its flowers are small and white or pale pink, and it is known for its ornamental value in horticulture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
